ProgramName: Master of Science in Accounting and Finance
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit proof of English language proficiency. Western New England University accepts the following: TOEFL (minimum score of 80 on the iBT), IELTS (minimum score of 6.5), PTE Academic (minimum score of 56), and Duolingo (minimum score of 105).
Requirements: Application requirements include: A completed Application for Admission to Graduate Study, official transcripts of all academic work from each college or university attended, two letters of recommendation, a current résumé, and a personal statement describing your reasons for pursuing a graduate degree and your professional goals.
Description: The Master of Science in Accounting and Finance (MSAF) is a 30-credit hour program that provides students with an advanced education in the fields of accounting and finance, helping them develop into sophisticated business professionals who can effectively navigate these important areas. The MSAF provides a broad education with specialized concentrations that help students focus their studies on particular interests. Students are prepared for a variety of leadership positions within private industry, government, and nonprofit organizations. Concentrations in Accounting and Finance are available to students. The Accounting Concentration prepares students for a career in public accounting as well as in corporate or government environments. The Finance Concentration provides students with an advanced education that will prepare them for a variety of careers in the financial services and investment industry.
ScholarshipType: Merit scholarships, Graduate assistantships, Alumni scholarships

ProgramName: Master of Science in Applied Behavior Analysis
EnglishScore: In addition to the requirements listed above, international applicants must submit a TOEFL or IELTS score. A TOEFL score of 80 on the Internet-based test (iBT) or an IELTS score of 6.5 is required for admission. Applicants who have successfully completed the English Language Services (ELS) Level 112 may also be considered for admission.
Requirements: To apply, students must submit the following: An official transcript from all universities and colleges attended, indicating the award of a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. A personal statement. Two letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to your academic and/or professional capabilities. A completed application.
Description: The 36-credit Master of Science in Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) at Western New England University will prepare you to seek licensure as an applied behavior analyst and sit for the Board Certified Behavior Analyst® (BCBA) examination. Applied behavior analysts work with children and adults with autism and other developmental disabilities in schools, homes, and clinical settings. This program can be completed either online or on campus in as little as 16-24 months and includes courses in ethics, foundational principles of behavior, and research. There are two practicum courses built into the curriculum to provide you with the fieldwork and supervision required for licensure.
Accredidation: The Association for Behavior Analysis International has verified the following courses toward the coursework requirements for eligibility to take the Board Certified Behavior Analyst® or Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst® examination. Applicants will need to meet additional requirements before they can be deemed eligible to take the examination.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency through one of the following: TOEFL: a minimum score of 80 on the Internet-based test (iBT), IELTS: a minimum score of 6.5, PTE Academic: a minimum score of 56, Duolingo: a minimum score of 105, ELS Language Center: successful completion of Level 112, or successful completion of a college-level English Composition course from an accredited U.S. college or university with a grade of B or better.
Requirements: A completed online application, including: Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended. Two letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to your academic and/or professional capabilities. Current résumé. Statement of Purpose: Describe in approximately 500 words your reasons for wishing to pursue graduate study at Western New England University. This essay should include your career goals and how a graduate degree from Western New England University will help you achieve them. $30 nonrefundable application fee. No GMAT/GRE Required.
Description: The Western New England University Master of Business Administration (MBA) program is focused on providing students with the skills they need for a lifetime of career success. With small classes, personalized attention, and a real-world approach to learning, our MBA gives you a competitive advantage in the workplace. Students learn to think critically, communicate effectively, analyze opportunities, and make sound judgments. In short, the WNE MBA program develops the managerial skills that can be applied to any industry. The WNE MBA will enable you to continue to grow professionally throughout your career, adding value to your organization as you advance through the ranks. In addition, the program is among the most affordable of any private AACSB International-accredited institution in the region. There is no better value in graduate business education.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Business Analytics
EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must submit official test scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE), or Duolingo English Test (DET) to demonstrate English proficiency. Western New England University also accepts the successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112 as proof of English proficiency.
Requirements: Completed online application and $50 application fee, Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended, Personal Statement, Current résumé, Two letters of recommendation, Official GMAT or GRE scores (may be waived).
Description: The 30-credit Master of Science in Business Analytics (MSBA) at Western New England University will position you for a career in this high-demand field by helping you develop the skills needed to create, analyze, and manage data-driven business solutions. With a curriculum focused on the managerial application of analytics, the MSBA is designed to equip you with quantitative and technical expertise, as well as the professional communication skills needed to lead with data. The curriculum integrates topics in data mining, statistical modeling, optimization, and simulation to drive business decisions. Our expert faculty will provide you with personal attention in a collaborative learning environment. Through case studies and hands-on experience, you will explore real-world challenges while developing the expertise to interpret data, identify trends, and leverage information to help organizations achieve a competitive advantage.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Civil Engineering
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must submit evidence of English language proficiency. Western New England University accepts the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 80 on the internet-based test (iBT), IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum overall band score of 6.5, Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105, PTE (Pearson Test of English) Academic with a minimum score of 56, or successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission to a graduate program at Western New England University, you will need to submit the following: Completed online application, Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended, Two letters of recommendation, A current résumé, A personal statement. For the Master of Science in Civil Engineering program, no GRE or GMAT is required.
Description: The Master of Science in Civil Engineering (MSCE) program will prepare you to take on leadership roles in the field through a course of study that is practice-oriented and flexible. The program provides advanced knowledge and skills in the planning, design, construction, and maintenance of the built environment. Offered on campus or 100% online, the curriculum allows students to choose a concentration in structural, geotechnical, environmental, or construction management. Full-time students can complete the program in just one year. You may also enroll part-time and complete your degree at your own pace. Classes are offered in the late afternoons and evenings to accommodate working professionals.
Accredidation: The College of Engineering is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, the global accreditor of college and university programs in applied and natural science, computing, engineering, and engineering technology.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Construction Management
EnglishScore: Applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency. This can be done by submitting one of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 80 on the iBT (our school code is 3962), IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum overall band score of 6.5, Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 115, ELS Language Centers, successful completion of Level 112, or Pearson (PTE Academic) with a minimum score of 56.
Requirements:
The following are required for admission to the MS in Construction Management program:

Completed online application and $30 fee.
Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended.
A personal statement describing your reasons for pursuing graduate study.
Two letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to your academic and/or professional potential.
A current résumé.
Description: The 30-credit Master of Science in Construction Management (MSCM) is designed for professionals in the design, engineering, and construction industries who seek to advance their careers and acquire leadership roles. The MSCM program offers advanced study in the management of construction projects from inception to completion, focusing on the management of resources, time, cost, quality, and safety. A unique feature of the program is its emphasis on sustainable design and construction, more commonly known as 'green building'.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Electrical Engineering
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate proficiency in the English language. This can be met through one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL): A minimum score of 80 on the internet-based test (iBT), 213 on the computer-based test, or 550 on the paper-based test. International English Language Testing System (IELTS): A minimum overall band score of 6.5. Pearson Test of English-Academic (PTE-A): A minimum score of 56. Duolingo English Test: A minimum score of 105. Successful completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Description: The Master of Science in Electrical Engineering (MSEE) is an innovative program that can be completed on a part-time or full-time basis, offering you the opportunity for advanced study in a variety of emphasis areas. The 30-credit curriculum has a flexible structure that allows students to customize a course of study suited to their career objectives. Our dedicated faculty members bring real-world experience to the classroom and are at the forefront of their fields, conducting innovative research in such areas as integrated photonics, nanotechnology, wireless communications, and robotics. Our close ties to industry leaders in the region and beyond, provide exceptional opportunities for internships and career placement. Areas of study include communication theory, digital signal processing, system theory, microelectronics, and photonics.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to 18 credits of tuition annually for Graduate Assistantships
ScholarshipType: Double Golden Bear Scholarship, Military Scholarship, Plus Program Scholarship, Merit scholarships, Graduate Assistantships

ProgramName: Master of Science in Engineering Management
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency by submitting scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE), ELS Language Centers (ELS), or Duolingo English Test. Minimum score requirements: TOEFL iBT 80, IELTS 6.5, PTE 56, or Duolingo English Test 105. An official ELS transcript with completion of level 112 with a 3.0 GPA is also accepted. The English proficiency testing requirement may be waived for students who have earned a degree from an institution in the United States, United Kingdom, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, or Canada (English-speaking provinces), or for students from select countries.
Description: The Master of Science in Engineering Management (MSEM) is a hybrid program designed to prepare you for a leadership role in the technology-based, project-driven enterprise. The MSEM will equip you with the fundamental business and management skills in areas such as project management, quality management, and operations management. As you sharpen your analytical and problem-solving skills, you will benefit from faculty who have years of experience as leaders in both industry and the classroom. Through case studies and hands-on projects, you will apply the knowledge you acquire to solving real-world management issues. The 10-course/30-credit curriculum includes seven core courses, two electives, and a capstone course. Elective courses offer you the flexibility to explore other disciplines or expand your expertise in a specific area.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Industrial Engineering
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. You may be exempt from this requirement if you have earned a degree from a college/university in the U.S. or other English-speaking country. English proficiency can be demonstrated by submitting one of the following: TOEFL minimum score of 80 on the iBT, IELTS minimum score of 6.5, Duolingo minimum score of 105, PTE Academic minimum score of 56, or successful completion of Level 112 at ELS Language Centers.
Description:
The Master of Science in Industrial Engineering (MSIE) program at Western New England University is designed to help you enhance your knowledge and skills to improve integrated systems of people, materials, information, facilities, and technology. You will acquire advanced skills in areas such as quality assurance, operations management, engineering management, systems engineering, supply chain management, and data analytics.

The MSIE is a 30-credit graduate program that offers both a thesis and a nonthesis option, as well as an option to transition seamlessly from our Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering program through our 5-year Bachelor/MSIE program. The program is flexible to accommodate the needs of both full-time students and working professionals and is structured to be completed in one calendar year for full-time students. The curriculum is comprised of eight courses and either a six-credit thesis or two additional courses for the nonthesis option. Classes for the program are offered on campus in the evenings.
ScholarshipPercentage: 10% tuition discount for alumni (Double Bearcat Scholarship)
ScholarshipType: Merit-based, Graduate Assistantships, STEM Scholarship, Alumni Discount

ProgramName: Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency by providing one of the following: Official TOEFL scores: 80 iBT or 550 PBT; Official IELTS score: 6.5; Official PTE score: 56; Official Duolingo score: 105; or Proof of successful completion of an approved ESL program (ELS Level 112). The requirement may be waived for students who have earned a degree from a U.S. institution or from a specific list of English-speaking countries.
Description: The Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MSME) is a 30-credit hour program that will deepen your understanding of the design, manufacture, and operation of mechanical and thermal systems. You’ll be prepared for leadership positions in the mechanical engineering field and have the opportunity to make an immediate impact on the job. The 30-credit MSME program has a flexible curriculum with no required core. You can tailor your studies to focus on an area of your interest by selecting from a wide range of available electives. The program offers advanced coursework and professional development in design and manufacturing engineering, mechanics and materials, and thermal fluid sciences.
ScholarshipType: Merit Scholarships, Graduate Assistantships, Alumni Scholarships, Double Beaver Scholarships

ProgramName: Master of Science in Medical Sciences
EnglishScore: Official results from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo English Test. Minimum Score Requirements: TOEFL: 79 iBT; IELTS: 6.0; Duolingo: 105.
Requirements:
Applicants must apply online and submit the following:
* Official college transcript(s) from all institutions attended
* A personal statement of career goals and why the applicant is a good fit for this program
* Three letters of recommendation (at least two must be from science faculty)
* A current résumé or curriculum vitae (CV)
Department: College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Medical Sciences (MSMS) is an intensive, one-year program designed for students who need to enhance their academic credentials for admission into medical, dental, or other health professional schools. Through our rigorous curriculum, the MSMS program will develop your critical thinking skills and strengthen your foundational knowledge in the medical sciences. The program emphasizes the practical application of knowledge in a supportive learning environment with small class sizes and personalized advising from our expert faculty. The MSMS program will provide you with a competitive advantage for professional school admission and a strong foundation for your future career as a healthcare professional.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Organizational Leadership
EnglishScore: Applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency through one of the following: TOEFL (80 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.5), Duolingo (115), PTE (56), or successful completion of ELS Level 112. Waivers may be granted to applicants from countries where English is the primary language or who have earned a degree from an accredited U.S. institution.
Description: The Master of Science in Organizational Leadership (MSOL) is an innovative program that prepares students for leadership roles in a variety of fields, including business and nonprofit organizations. This 30-credit graduate program is offered fully online or in a blended format of online and in-person classes to give working professionals the flexibility they need to earn a degree while meeting their professional and personal responsibilities. The MSOL program features a cutting-edge curriculum taught by faculty with exceptional academic credentials and extensive leadership experience. Through an emphasis on both the science and art of leadership, students will develop the critical skills and knowledge needed to become a truly effective and inspirational leader. The MSOL program welcomes a diverse student body from a wide variety of academic backgrounds and professional organizations.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International—The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business, the premier accrediting body for business schools in the world. Less than 5% of business schools worldwide have earned this prestigious designation.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Pharmaceutical Sciences
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English. This can be accomplished through TOEFL (minimum score of 80 Internet-based), IELTS (minimum score of 6.5), Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE) (minimum score of 56), Duolingo English Test (minimum score of 115), or successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements:
Completed online application and $30 fee
Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended
A bachelor's degree in chemistry, biology, pharmacy, or related fields from a regionally accredited institution is required.
Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher is required.
International applicants: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) score of 80, an International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 6.5, a Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE) score of 56, or an EIKEN score of Pre-1.
Official test scores are required for all international students.
Personal statement: a brief essay of at least 250 words describing your reasons for pursuing a graduate degree and your academic/research interests and goals.
Two letters of recommendation
Résumé
No GRE, GMAT, or PCAT required for admission.
Department: College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences
Description: The 32-credit Master of Science in Pharmaceutical Sciences program at Western New England University will prepare you for a dynamic career in this growing field. As more and more people seek medical care for their ailments, the demand for medications and the people who develop them increases. With your MS in Pharmaceutical Sciences, you will be well positioned to assume a role in pharmaceutical research in an academic or industrial environment. You may also choose to pursue a PhD or other doctoral level degrees. The program is specifically designed to address a need for skilled individuals with working knowledge of pharmaceutical sciences, including a range of topics from drug discovery and development to drug dosage formulations and applications in a clinical setting. With state-of-the-art labs in the Center for the Sciences and Pharmacy, you will gain hands-on experience using industry-standard equipment and procedures.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must provide evidence of English language proficiency. This can be demonstrated by one of the following: A minimum score of 80 on the internet-based exam (iBT); A minimum overall band score of 6.5 on the IELTS; A minimum score of 105 on the Duolingo English Test; A minimum score of 56 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic; Completion of ELS Language Centers level 112 with a certificate of completion; Successful completion of a degree program at an accredited U.S. institution; Successful completion of a degree program at an institution outside the U.S. where English is the official language of instruction.
Department: College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences
Description: The Western New England University Online Master of Science in Pharmacogenomics (MSPGx) is one of the nation's first such programs, preparing students for careers in this new and exciting field of personalized medicine. You will gain the knowledge and skills needed to understand how a patient's genetic makeup affects their response to drugs. The MSPGx is a 31-credit, fully online program that does not require a residency. Students will enroll as a cohort and can complete the program in two years by taking 1-2 courses per semester. You will learn to predict drug responses, both in terms of efficacy and toxicity, for individual patients based on their genetic information.
ScholarshipType: Merit Scholarships, Graduate Assistantships, Alumni Scholarships

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by taking the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Duolingo English Test, or Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic and obtaining the minimum scores listed below. Our institution code is 3962. TOEFL: 79 (Internet-based) or 550 (Paper-based); IELTS: 6.0; Duolingo English Test: 105; PTE Academic: 53
Requirements:
All application materials must be submitted through the Occupational Therapy Centralized Application Service (OTCAS). A completed application includes:

*   Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended.
*   Three letters of recommendation. We strongly suggest that you provide letters from an academic source, a work supervisor, and a healthcare provider.
*   A minimum of 40 hours of observation of occupational therapy services in at least two different practice settings is required. We strongly recommend that you seek out observation experiences in a variety of practice settings and with a variety of client populations. Please note that these hours must be completed prior to submitting your application.
*   A personal essay addressing why you selected occupational therapy as a career and how an occupational therapy degree relates to your immediate and long-term professional goals.
*   A personal interview with a member of the OTD faculty will be required for qualified applicants. The interview is an opportunity for us to learn more about you, and for you to learn more about our program. Interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis beginning in the fall.
*   Prerequisite Courses
*   A cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale is required.
*   A prerequisite GPA of 3.2 or higher on a 4.0 scale is required. All prerequisite courses must have a grade of C or better. All science prerequisites must have been taken within the last 10 years.
*   The GRE is NOT required for admission to the OTD Program.
Department: College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences
Description: The entry-level Doctor of Occupational Therapy (OTD) program provides a clear path to a successful career as a certified occupational therapist. As a graduate of our OTD program, you will be prepared for entry-level practice in a variety of traditional and emerging settings, including hospitals, community-based practice, and academia. As a practitioner, you will collaborate with clients, families, and communities to promote health, well-being, and participation in life through engagement in occupation. You will become a lifelong learner, leader, and advocate for the clients and communities that you serve. Our innovative OTD curriculum incorporates principles of occupational justice into coursework and clinical experiences. With a focus on justice and service to the community, our students develop advocacy skills to support the health and wellness of individuals and groups. Our program provides a high-quality education that is career-focused, student-centered, and taught by faculty experts in their practice areas.
Accredidation: The entry-level occupational therapy doctoral degree program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Occupational Therapy Education (ACOTE) of the American Occupational Therapy Association (AOTA), located at 6116 Executive Boulevard, Suite 200, North Bethesda, MD 20852-4929. ACOTE’s telephone number c/o AOTA is (301) 652-AOTA and its Web address is www.acoteonline.org. Graduates of the program will be eligible to sit for the national certification examination for the occupational therapist administered by the National Board for Certification in Occupational Therapy (NBCOT). After successful completion of this exam, the individual will be an Occupational Therapist, Registered (OTR).

EnglishScore: Proof of English Language Proficiency. This requirement is waived for applicants from English-speaking countries as identified by the U.S. government, or for those who have successfully completed at least two years of study at a college or university in the United States. A minimum score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) of 80 on the iBT (internet based test), or 550 on the paper-based test. IELTS scores of 6.0 or higher will also be accepted in lieu of the TOEFL. The Duolingo English Test is also accepted. A minimum score of 105 is required.
Department: College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences
Description: The four-year Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) program at Western New England University is future-focused, providing you with a strong foundation in the pharmaceutical and clinical sciences. Through our innovative curriculum, you will gain an understanding of how to apply this knowledge to a wide variety of patient populations in diverse practice settings. An emphasis on interprofessional education, along with experiential opportunities starting in your first semester, will prepare you to be a practice-ready pharmacist and a valuable member of the healthcare team. We offer early assurance opportunities for qualified high school students and guaranteed progression for qualified WNE undergraduate students from a variety of science and health majors. Through our affiliations, we also provide a streamlined admissions process for qualified students from a variety of undergraduate institutions. These pathways provide a seamless transition into our professional program. The six-year PharmD pathway allows students to earn their bachelor’s and Doctor of Pharmacy degrees through an accelerated program of study. In our small classes, you’ll learn from our distinguished faculty who have extensive experience as both researchers and practitioners. As a result of their diverse expertise, you will be exposed to a broad spectrum of career opportunities that exist in the field of pharmacy. Our faculty will challenge and support you as you develop into a leader who is able to provide compassionate care to a diverse patient population. Our graduates are highly sought after by employers for their ability to think critically, communicate effectively, and collaborate successfully with other members of the healthcare team as they serve their communities.
Accredidation: The Western New England University Doctor of Pharmacy program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education, 190 South LaSalle Street, Suite 3000, Chicago, IL 60603, 312-664-3575; FAX 866-228-2631, web site www.acpe-accredit.org.

ProgramName: Doctor of Philosophy in Behavior Analysis
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting ONE of the following: TOEFL: Minimum score of 80 (iBT), IELTS: Minimum score of 6.5, Duolingo English Test: Minimum score of 105, PTE Academic: Minimum score of 56, or successful completion of ELS Level 112. The English proficiency requirement may be waived for applicants who have earned a bachelor's or graduate degree from a college or university in the United States, United Kingdom, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, or Canada (except Quebec).
Requirements:
A completed online application and a $30 application fee.
A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with a preferred GPA of 3.0 or higher.
A master’s degree in behavior analysis or a closely related field (e.g., psychology, education) from an accredited institution. A GPA of 3.5 or higher is preferred. Applicants with a bachelor’s degree and substantial experience in behavior analysis may be considered for admission.
Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
A statement of purpose describing the applicant's research interests and career goals.
Two letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to the applicant’s academic and/or professional potential.
A curriculum vitae (CV).
A writing sample demonstrating scholarly writing ability (e.g., master's thesis, published article).
An interview with program faculty.
Description: The PhD in Behavior Analysis program is a full-time, campus-based program designed to train the next generation of leaders in the field of behavior analysis. Students will engage in advanced coursework in behavior analysis and develop a sophisticated repertoire of research and clinical skills. Students will contribute to the scholarly literature in behavior analysis through the completion of an empirical dissertation, and will complete a post-doctoral fellowship following coursework. The mission of the doctoral program in Behavior Analysis at Western New England University is to provide students with a rigorous course of study in behavior analysis that will prepare them for a career as a scientist-practitioner in the field. Graduates will be prepared to work in a variety of academic and clinical roles, and engage in research, teaching, and clinical practice. The doctoral program provides a stimulating and collegial learning environment, and opportunities for students to develop close working relationships with faculty mentors and with their peers. Students will work closely with their faculty mentors to design and implement a program of research in a selected area. In addition, students have a number of opportunities to gain supervised experience in teaching at the undergraduate and graduate level, and will have a variety of clinical experiences available to them at the University and in the community. The Association for Behavior Analysis International has verified the following courses toward the coursework requirements for eligibility to take the Board Certified Behavior Analyst® or Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst® examination. Applicants will need to meet additional requirements before they can be deemed eligible to take the examination.
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition scholarship and an annual stipend

ProgramName: Doctor of Philosophy in Engineering Management
EnglishScore: Official TOEFL or IELTS score for international applicants. All applicants for whom English is not their native language must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met in one of the following ways: TOEFL: a minimum score of 80 on the internet-based test (iBT), IELTS: a minimum overall band score of 6.5, Duolingo English Test: a minimum score of 105, ELS Language Center: successful completion of Level 112, Pearson (PTE Academic): a minimum score of 56.
Description: The Western New England University PhD in Engineering Management is designed for engineering and business professionals with STEM backgrounds who wish to conduct in-depth research to solve problems in complex engineering/technical systems. The curriculum offers a distinctive blend of qualitative and quantitative analysis, and a well-rounded business approach for managing technology, innovation, and people within an engineering or technical enterprise. While developing expertise as a world-class researcher, you will gain the skills and knowledge to lead organizations through complex technical and business challenges and bring a scholarly perspective and approach to your career in industry, research, or academia.

ProgramName: Doctor of Philosophy in Industrial Management
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. Western New England University accepts the following to prove proficiency: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) - The minimum score is 80 on the iBT (Internet-based test); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) - The minimum score is 6.5; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic - The minimum score is 56; Duolingo English Test - The minimum score is 105; Completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements:
The following must be submitted to be considered for admission:

Completed online application and $50 application fee (fee waived for WNE alumni, students, and employees; military personnel; and open house attendees).
Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended. (A minimum GPA of 3.0 is required. Applicants with a GPA below 3.0 may be considered for conditional acceptance.)
A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university is required. A master’s degree is preferred.
Two letters of recommendation from individuals who know you in a professional or academic capacity and can attest to your ability to succeed in a graduate program.
A Statement of Purpose highlighting academic and professional goals.
A current résumé or curriculum vitae (CV).
PhD applicants who earned a degree from a non-U.S. institution must take the TOEFL or IELTS exam unless they have earned a degree from a U.S. institution.
Description: Western New England University offers the only part-time PhD in Industrial Management in the United States, providing a unique pathway for working professionals to earn a terminal degree. This practice-oriented program is designed for industrial managers who seek to solve significant industry problems from an applied, interdisciplinary perspective. The program prepares students to become industry thought leaders, C-suite executives, and professors at teaching-oriented academic institutions. Our students are working professionals from a wide array of industries, including aerospace, healthcare, pharmaceuticals, manufacturing, and defense. This diversity leads to rich classroom experiences where students can share their real-world examples to enhance their learning. The PhD in Industrial Management degree is a STEM designated degree (CIP Code 15.1501). The program is not intended to be a distance learning program and requires in-person attendance.

EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not their native language are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL). A minimum score of 100 on the iBT, or 600 on the paper-based test, is required.
Concentration: ['Business Law', 'Criminal Law', 'Estate Planning', 'Gender and Sexuality Law', 'International and Comparative Law', 'Public Interest Law', 'Real Estate Law']
Description: Our Juris Doctor (JD) degree is your gateway to a successful and satisfying legal career. The foundation of the JD curriculum is a rigorous program of required courses that provides students with a firm grounding in the core subjects of legal education. Building upon this foundation, students may choose from an extensive menu of elective courses to focus on particular areas of interest, including a variety of clinical and skills courses designed to ensure that they are 'practice ready' upon graduation. To earn the Juris Doctor degree, students must complete 89 credit hours of study and the Upper Level Writing Requirement. Our full-time program is typically completed in three years and our part-time programs in four years. The School of Law offers a variety of course scheduling options, including a full-time day program, a part-time day program, and a part-time evening program.
Accredidation: Western New England University School of Law is an ABA-approved law school.

ProgramName: Master of Laws (LL.M.) in Elder Law and Estate Planning
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS). A minimum score of 550 on the paper-based test, 213 on the computer-based test, or 80 on the internet-based test (iBT) is required on the TOEFL. A minimum score of 6.0 is required on the IELTS. Applicants who have earned a baccalaureate or graduate degree from a college or university in the United States, United Kingdom, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, or Canada (except Quebec) are not required to take the TOEFL or IELTS.
Requirements: Applicants must complete an application for admission. The application for the Estate Planning track is administered through the Law School Admission Council (LSAC) at www.lsac.org. The application for the Elder Law track is a downloadable application that may be submitted directly to the School of Law. A $40 nonrefundable application fee must be submitted with your application. Applicants must have official copies of their law school transcripts sent directly to the School of Law. Applicants must submit a personal statement of one to three pages. The personal statement should be a narrative that enables the Admissions Committee to learn more about the applicant and his/her motivation to pursue the LLM. Applicants should submit a current resume that includes their employment history and any other relevant activities, such as publications, and pro bono or community service. Letters of recommendation are not required, but are strongly encouraged.
Description: The Master of Laws (LL.M.) in Elder Law and Estate Planning is the preeminent program for attorneys who wish to gain sophistication in these two expanding areas of practice. Offered exclusively online, this 24-credit graduate program is designed for legal professionals to build expertise that will help them advance their careers and best serve their clients’ needs. The program is offered on a part-time basis, enabling busy professionals to balance work and family life while earning their advanced degree. All courses are offered completely online and can be accessed at any time of day, from anywhere. Our highly-regarded faculty of legal scholars are among the most accomplished and recognized leaders in their fields, with decades of practice and practical experience. Students will learn how to provide holistic, client-centered service, with a curriculum focused on the unique legal issues facing older adults and their families.
Accredidation: Western New England University School of Law is accredited by the American Bar Association (ABA) Council of the Section of Legal Education and Admissions to the Bar.

EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you will need to provide proof of English proficiency. This can be done by submitting one of the following: TOEFL: 79 (iBT) or 550 (PBT); IELTS: 6.0; PTE Academic: 53; Duolingo English Test: 105; ELS Language Center's Level 112 Certificate.
Description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming nearly every industry, from healthcare and finance to transportation and entertainment. As AI technology continues to advance, there is a growing demand for skilled professionals who can develop, implement, and manage AI systems. The Graduate Certificate in Artificial Intelligence from Western New England University is designed to provide you with the knowledge and skills needed to succeed in this dynamic field. In this program, you will learn the fundamentals of AI, including machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, and computer vision. You will also gain hands-on experience with popular AI tools and platforms, such as Python, TensorFlow, and PyTorch. The certificate program is designed to be flexible and can be completed online or in person. It is also a stackable credential that can be applied toward the MS in Electrical Engineering or the MS in Computer Engineering at WNE. With a graduate certificate in AI from WNE, you will be prepared for a variety of careers in the AI field, including AI engineer, machine learning engineer, data scientist, and AI research scientist. You will also be well-equipped to pursue further graduate studies in AI or a related field. With the skills and knowledge you gain, graduates of the AI graduate certificate program will be well-positioned to take on leadership roles in this exciting and rapidly growing field.

EnglishScore: International graduate applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency. This can be done by submitting ONE of the following: a minimum score of 80 on the TOEFL iBT, a 6.5 on the IELTS, a 56 on the PTE Academic, or a 105 on the Duolingo English Test. Completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center will also be accepted.
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Business Foundations provides students with a foundational knowledge of business management and is a great option for those interested in a career in business or as a first step to pursuing an MBA. The 15-credit (5-course) certificate can be completed in as little as two semesters and all credits can be applied towards a Western New England University MBA.
Accredidation: College of Business Accredited by AACSB International

EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit proof of English proficiency. This requirement is waived for applicants from English-speaking countries. Western New England University accepts the following to prove English proficiency: TOEFL: a minimum score of 80 on the iBT is required. IELTS: a minimum overall band score of 6.5 is required. PTE Academic: a minimum score of 58 is required. Duolingo English Test: a minimum score of 105 is required. Successful completion of the ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements:
For admission to the Graduate Certificate in Data Analytics, applicants must possess a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must submit the following to be considered for admission:

Completed online application
Official transcripts of all undergraduate and graduate coursework
A current résumé
$30 application fee
Please note that GMAT/GRE scores are NOT required for admission to this program.
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Data Analytics is designed for individuals who are interested in developing analytical skills to support data-driven decision-making in a wide variety of organizational roles and settings. Students will learn the concepts and tools of data mining and business analytics and apply them to data sets in a variety of fields using current software. The certificate consists of four courses (12 credits) that can be completed in as few as two semesters.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International, which places us in the top 5% of business schools in the world.

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English. If your native language is not English, you must submit official scores from one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 80 on the Internet-based test (iBT); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum overall band score of 6.5; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a minimum score of 56. Successful completion of ELS Level 112 will also satisfy the University's English language proficiency requirement.
Requirements:
A completed online application
Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended
Current résumé
Statement of Purpose
One letter of recommendation
Official GMAT or GRE scores are not required for admission to our graduate certificate programs. Scores may be submitted to strengthen your application.
Description: In an increasingly complex and interconnected global economy, the importance of sound financial decision-making has never been greater. Whether you work for a financial institution, a corporation, a nonprofit organization, or are simply interested in better managing your own finances, the Graduate Certificate in Finance will empower you to make more intelligent financial decisions. The 15-credit program can be completed online or in-person in as little as two semesters.
Accredidation: The College of Business at Western New England University is accredited by AACSB International.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by providing an official score report for TOEFL (80 iBT), IELTS (6.5), PTE Academic (56), or Duolingo English Test (105). Proficiency can also be demonstrated by successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center, successful completion of a college-level English Composition course from an accredited U.S. institution with a grade of B or better, or graduation from a U.S. high school, college, or university.
Requirements: The following materials are required to complete an application for all graduate programs at Western New England University: Completed Online Application and $30 Application Fee, Official Transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended, Essay/Personal Statement, Résumé, Two Letters of Recommendation. Test Scores (GMAT/GRE) may be required for some programs, but are not specified as required for the Graduate Certificate in Financial Accounting.
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Financial Accounting from Western New England University will prepare you to take your career to the next level. In our AACSB International-accredited program, you will develop the specialized financial accounting knowledge that will enable you to confidently analyze, interpret, and communicate crucial accounting and financial reporting information to advance company goals. In just a few semesters, you will be able to take your career in corporate accounting or public accounting to a new level. The certificate will prepare you for careers as auditors, forensic accountants, financial analysts, controllers, and treasurers, and will provide an excellent foundation for pursuing CPA licensure. Required Courses include Financial Accounting and Reporting, Advanced Financial Accounting, and Auditing and Assurance Services.
Accredidation: As the only private institution in western Massachusetts with AACSB International accreditation, and one of only a few in the state, the College of Business offers programs of the highest quality.

EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you will be required to submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL (79 iBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (53), and Duolingo English Test (105). Successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center also satisfies this requirement. The requirement may be waived for applicants who have earned a degree from specific English-speaking countries or have worked full-time in the U.S. for at least two years.
Description: Six Sigma is a disciplined, data-driven approach and methodology for eliminating defects in any process—from manufacturing to transactional and from product to service. The fundamental objective of the Six Sigma methodology is the implementation of a measurement-based strategy that focuses on process improvement and variation reduction through the application of Six Sigma improvement projects. This is accomplished through the use of two Six Sigma sub-methodologies: DMAIC (define, measure, analyze, improve, control) and DMADV (define, measure, analyze, design, verify). A Six Sigma Green Belt is an employee of a company who has been trained on the Six Sigma improvement methodology and will lead a process improvement team as part of their full-time job. Our 12-credit Green Belt Certificate program is ideal for business and industrial managers, engineers, supervisors, and others in positions of leadership or who aspire to leadership positions and who are interested in process improvement. You will gain a set of tools to improve quality in business organizations. Your studies will include topics in basic probability and statistics, statistical quality control, and the design of experiments. All courses are applicable toward the MS in Industrial Engineering or MS in Engineering Management.

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Industrial Safety and Public Health
EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you will be required to submit proof of English language proficiency. Options include TOEFL iBT (79), IELTS (6.0), PTE (53), Duolingo English Test (105), or successful completion of ELS Language Center Level 112.
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Industrial Safety and Public Health will focus on the anticipation, recognition, evaluation, and control of safety, injury, and illness in the workplace. This includes risk management, workers’ compensation, fire safety, regulatory compliance, industrial hygiene, emergency preparedness, and the construction industry. This certificate will be beneficial to individuals working in a variety of fields including manufacturing, construction, insurance, healthcare, and public service. This certificate may lead to the Certified Safety Professional (CSP) certification, which is the gold standard in safety certification.

Data and information are valuable commodities in any business. Effective information management is essential to compete in the complex and constantly changing business world. The Graduate Certificate in Information Management provides you with an understanding of information technologies and their impact on data and information management.
Accredidation: The College of Business, which offers this program, is accredited by AACSB International.

EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries are required to provide proof of English proficiency. This can be demonstrated by one of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 80 on the internet-based test (iBT), IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum score of 6.5, PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English) with a minimum score of 56, Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 105, or successful completion of a recognized academic English program such as ELS Level 112. Applicants holding an undergraduate or graduate degree from a U.S. college or university are not required to take an English proficiency exam.
Requirements: To apply for the Graduate Certificate in Leadership, applicants must submit a completed online application and a $30 fee, along with official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended. Additional requirements for business certificate applicants include a one-page personal statement describing your background and reasons for pursuing a graduate degree at Western New England University, and a current résumé. One letter of recommendation is optional. GMAT and GRE test scores are not required.
Description: The 15-credit Graduate Certificate in Leadership offers professionals in all fields the opportunity to strengthen and develop their leadership and managerial skills to become more effective in their work and improve their career advancement opportunities. The Graduate Certificate curriculum consists of five courses that address the development of key leadership skills, including conflict resolution, decision making, negotiation, and change management. Students may apply the certificate courses to the MS in Organizational Leadership.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International—The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business, an honor earned by only 5% of business schools worldwide.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL (minimum 80 Internet-based), IELTS (minimum 6.5), Duolingo (minimum 105), or PTE Academic (minimum 56). Provisional admission is available for students who complete level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: Students applying to a certificate program or as a nondegree student need only to complete the online application and submit official transcripts from all institutions attended.
Description: In an increasingly competitive global marketplace, organizations must optimize the performance of their business processes to stay competitive. In fact, many companies have learned that in order to truly excel, they must not only optimize their internal operations, but also the operations of their supply chain partners. The Certificate in Operations Management will provide you with cutting-edge skills and the latest concepts in the field, including project management, lean systems, supply chain management, and quality management. A key feature of the Certificate is its focus on state-of-the-art tools and techniques to optimize performance in both manufacturing and service organizations.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International—the premier accrediting body for business schools.

EnglishScore: Students for whom English is not their native language must submit proof of English language proficiency. The following are accepted: TOEFL with a minimum score of 80 on the Internet-based test (iBT) or 550 on the paper-based test (PBT); IELTS with a minimum score of 6.5; PTE Academic with a minimum score of 56; Duolingo English Test (DET) with a minimum score of 105; or successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: Completed Application, Official Transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended, Statement of Purpose, Current Résumé, Letters of Recommendation (optional), GMAT or GRE Test Scores*, TOEFL or IELTS (International Applicants). *The GMAT/GRE is waived for applicants who have a cumulative GPA of 3.3 or higher, or five or more years of progressive professional experience.
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Operations Research will provide you with a unique opportunity to build specialized knowledge in quantitative methods of analysis used to make informed management decisions. You’ll become equipped with the ability to build sophisticated mathematical models and apply them with computer technology to resolve complex problems in business and industry. The four-course curriculum covers the fundamentals of optimization, stochastic systems, simulation, and quality management. It can be taken either as a standalone certificate or as a stepping-stone into the MS in Industrial Engineering program.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be accomplished by submitting a TOEFL score of 79 iBT, an IELTS score of 6.5, a PTE Academic score of 58, a Duolingo English Test score of 105, or through completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: Applicants must hold a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university. All applicants must submit the following: Application for Graduate Admission, Official transcript of all academic work, Two letters of recommendation. International students must also submit the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) and a WES evaluation. For more information, please visit the International Admissions section.
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Project Management at Western New England University is an ideal program for professionals looking to build on their expertise and earn a credential that demonstrates their knowledge of the field. The certificate is comprised of four courses that cover the essentials of managing projects from initiation through closing. As a student in our AACSB International accredited College of Business, you will develop the skills to make data-driven decisions. The program is offered fully online to offer you the flexibility to complete your coursework at your own pace.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International—The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Risk and Emergency Management
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. Western New England University accepts the following to demonstrate proficiency: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE), Duolingo English Test (DET). The English proficiency test requirement may be waived for applicants who: Are a citizen of a country where English is the official language. Have earned a degree from a college/university in the United States or a country where English is the official language. Have successfully completed level 112 of the ELS Language Centers program.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you will need to submit the following: Completed Online Application, Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended, Current résumé, One-page statement of purpose, One Letter of Recommendation (Some programs require two. Check program pages for specific requirements.), Application Fee of $30.00, Official GMAT/GRE scores (Many programs are test-optional or test-waived. Check program pages for specific requirements.)
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Risk and Emergency Management will develop professionals who want to work in all hazards planning, response, mitigation, and recovery. In an era where extreme weather, security threats, and other emergencies can disrupt society, emergency management and business continuity professionals are required by government agencies and businesses alike. Our flexible online format will help you meet your professional goals to enhance your skills and credentials.

EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you will need to demonstrate your proficiency by submitting official test scores from one of the following exams: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL): minimum score of 80 on the iBT, International English Language Testing System (IELTS): minimum score of 6.5, Duolingo English Test: minimum score of 105, or Pearson Test of English (PTE): minimum score of 56. The English language proficiency test requirement may be waived on a case-by-case basis if you have earned a bachelor’s or master’s degree from an accredited U.S. institution.
Requirements:
A completed online application
A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution
Official transcripts of all undergraduate and graduate coursework
One letter of recommendation (academic or professional)
A personal statement
A current résumé
An interview may be requested at the discretion of the Program Director.
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Sport Leadership is a 12-credit program that prepares students for leadership positions within intercollegiate and interscholastic athletics, as well as with professional sport organizations, and in the private and public recreation sectors. The certificate program focuses on building a foundation of leadership skills that will prepare graduates for ethical decision-making and various other management duties within the sport industry. The certificate is especially valuable for those seeking leadership opportunities such as athletic director or other administrative positions within an athletic department. Students seeking the certificate will take four required courses from our Master of Science in Sport Leadership and Coaching (MSSLC) program.

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency. One of the following is required: TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo English Test, Pearson PTE-Academic, ELS Language Center Level 112 completion, or successful completion of an academic program in the US or other English-speaking country.
Requirements:
Completed online application
Official transcripts of all undergraduate and graduate coursework
A personal statement
A current résumé
One letter of recommendation (optional)
GMAT/GRE is not required for this program
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Strategic Decision-Making is designed for individuals seeking to enhance their analytical and leadership skills to make informed, strategic choices in a variety of organizational contexts. This program equips students with the tools and frameworks necessary to assess complex situations, evaluate potential outcomes, and implement effective decisions that align with organizational goals. By focusing on critical thinking, data analysis, and strategic foresight, the certificate prepares professionals to navigate uncertainty and drive success in their careers. Whether you are a mid-career manager looking to advance, an entrepreneur aiming to grow your business, or a professional transitioning into a leadership role, this certificate provides the essential knowledge and practical skills to excel in today’s dynamic business environment. The program consists of 12 credits, a GRE/GMAT is not required for admission.

EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not their native language, must submit proof of English proficiency. Acceptable proof includes a minimum score of 79 on the TOEFL iBT, 6.0 on the IELTS, 53 on the PTE, or 105 on the Duolingo English Test. Completion of ELS Language Center's Level 112 with a grade of B or higher, or successful completion of a degree program where English is the official language of instruction are also accepted.
Requirements: Admission to a Graduate Certificate program requires an earned bachelor’s degree in a related field from an accredited college or university. An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or better is required. Under special circumstances, an applicant with a GPA below 3.0 may be admitted on a conditional basis. To apply, complete the online application. There is no application fee.
Description: The four-course certificate focuses on managing the flow of goods and services, and includes the movement and storage of raw materials, of work-in-process inventory, and of finished goods from point of origin to point of consumption. Courses can be applied toward the MS in Industrial Engineering or MS in Engineering Management.

EnglishScore: Official TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo English test score results are required. A minimum score of 79 on the internet-based TOEFL, 6.0 on the IELTS, or 105 on the Duolingo English test is required for admission.
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Tax Planning is a 12-credit, four-course graduate certificate program focused on providing students with the knowledge and skills necessary for a professional career in taxation. All of the courses are applicable to the Master of Science in Accounting (MSA), Master of Science in Accounting and Taxation (MSAT), or the Master of Laws (LLM) in Estate Planning and Elder Law.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International-the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.
